ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Mid Fetch filter
ygData.msgSnippet: At best, the mid-fetch filter can abort a fetch that s already begun. As your log shows 1x1 GIFs way smaller than a single TCP packet, the abort in those cases

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Mid Fetch filter
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=wxWuO0-93WwDD-AdbU6tBCCSfhoUwVrq9Sf_eS6nzcIL
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

At best, the mid-fetch filter can abort a fetch that's already begun.

As your log shows 1x1 GIFs way smaller than a single TCP packet, the 
abort in those cases is likely to be irrelevant to the server -- as far 
as it's concerned, it already finished serving the request.

Even with a large GIF, I don't know if the server-side log would show 
anything other than a successful response. (It would depend on how 
broken connections are logged.)

On the crawler side, I think even a mid-fetch abort leaves the entry in 
the crawl.log and at least truncated content available for writing to 
W/ARC files. Are you seeing or expecting something different?

- Gordon @ IA
